Setting the Number of Log-on Attempts

You can add additional security to your project by setting a log-on failure setting and duration. One reason for log-on failure is hackers trying to figure out passwords for users. It is recommended that you configure the server configuration so that members of the Security Administrators group are notified by e-mail about log-on failures and lockouts.

Any user can be locked out of a server configuration when the number of retries with the wrong password has been exceeded. However, the lockout period for the main administrative account (Administrator) is limited to 24 hours, although another user with administrative rights or privileges can reactivate the account earlier. All other accounts are locked out until the account is reactivated.

Note: This function can be performed only for servers that are currently running.

To limit log-on attempts:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server.

    • From the client, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam client_name > Server Administration (available with custom installations only).

    The Server Administration dialog appears.  

  2. Select a server configuration from the left pane. If you have not yet logged onto the server configuration, you will be asked to do so. If you are using the client, you can administer remote servers only.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Accounts bar in the lower left panel. Then click the System Policy shortcut.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Accounts > System Policy.

    The System Policy dialog opens.

  4. Select the Logon Failures tab.

  5. Select one of the Logon Failure options:

    • Ignore. This disables logon failures.

    • Lockout Account After ___ Failures. Enter the number of logon failures to be permitted.

  6. Select one of the following Lockout duration options:

    • Forever. With this option selected, only the administrator can reinstate the user.

    • Keep locked for ___ minutes. Enter number of minutes for the lockout duration. The user will be able to log on again after the designated timeout period.

  7. To notify members of the Security Administrators group about users who were locked out or attempted to log on unsuccessfully, select the By E-mail check box.

  8. Click OK.
